Body: What We've Learned Updated: there is a syslog-ng log file that does not get rotated and I need to ask about it.
Next Steps Updated: see if there is a reason why the file does not rotate
Next Steps Updated: monitor until Monday and see about the status
What We've Learned Updated: due to a faulty SIEM configuration that runs alongside the correct one, syslog was processed but not sent to the SIEM server
What We've Learned Updated: another issue seen is that they have over 38mil file tracing logs which increases the DB

Next Steps Updated: will ask for a procedure to clear the 1140.
the customer will see how they can remove file tracing from the noisy computers

What We've Learned Updated: we set the automatic audit log backup to archive everything older than 1 month.
removed the large file /var/eppfiles/syslog-ng.00005.rqf.corrupted
the SIEM receives the logs but if there are any issues with the connection they are a backup, but in this case they are actually communicating properly

Next Steps Updated: will meet again on December 30 to check the syslog file if it is not rotated properly.
Bharani will test with the user remediation for DC
Next Steps Updated: we need to wait for the customer to get all the internal approvals for the optimizations proposed and will check back in 2 weeks from today (December 30 2024)
What We've Learned Updated: the disk space issue was caused by the audit log that created the backups. it was cleared two days later after it was done
